channel.title: R package on fboehm.us
channel.description: Recent content in R package on fboehm.us

item.title: qtl2pleio on CRAN
item.author: frederick.boehm@gmail.com (Frederick J. Boehm)
item.description: CRAN now hosts the packages qtl2pleio and gemma2. qtl2pleio performs a d-variate, d-QTL scan over a select genomic region. gemma2 is used by qtl2pleio for the inference of multivariate variance components. They can be installed with: install.packages("qtl2pleio") The statistical model that qtl2pleio fits for each d-tuple of markers (or pseudomarkers) is \[ vec(Y) = Xvec(B) + vec(G) + vec(E) \] where \(Y\) is a n by d matrix of d traits (for each of n subjects), X is a dn by df block-diagonal matrix of founder allele probabilities, B is a f by d matrix of allele effects for each of d traits, G is a n by d matrix of polygenic random effects, and E is a n by d matrix of random errors.

item.title: R package site incorporation into my personal website
item.author: frederick.boehm@gmail.com (Frederick J. Boehm)
item.description: Overview I’ve been developing the R package qtl2pleio. It’s now at a stage where others can use it. I recently found the R package pkgdown, which allows developers to build, in an automated fashion, websites for their packages. I posted an entry on pkgdown earlier this year. I now wish to communicate my strategy for incorporating the package site into my personal website, https://fboehm.us. I write this primarily as a reminder to myself.
